Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; PAINTED
Name: Dish
Description: Crude example of a dish with a concave base, an extremely flared body in the shape of an S (with a rounded lip in continuation of the body). The clay is fine, compact, heterogeneous (mineral and organic temper) and buff-coloured. The workmanship is rather crude and the polish quite succinct. Nonetheless, both the interior and the rim are decorated with concentric bands of white paint.
